org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington Spokane County

body.p:
ORDINANCE NO. 305 An ordinance to establish the limits and
The city of Spokane Falls does ordain as follows:

Section 1. Spokane Falls of and be bounded as follows, to-wit commencing at the junction of the north side of Sprague street and of street, running to the south side of Front street. Thence west to the east side of Mill Street; thence south to the west side of Main Street: thence west to the east side of Post street: thence south to the south side of the block No. 13; thence west parallel with the south side of said alley to the west line of 1st No.11 to block No. 29; thence south along said west line of lot 11 to Riverside avenue; thence south across Riverside avenue to the west line of lot 2, block 23; thence south along the west line of said lot 2 and lot 11 to the north side of Sprague stree; thence east along the north side of street to Stevens street by the place of beginning.

SEC., 2. All buildings hereafter erected within said fire limits shall have their outside and dirty walls made of incombustible material not less than one foot in thickness and shall extend from the foundation to the top of and above the roof of such building. And the roof of each building shall also be constructed of incombustible material, and the walls and roof of such building so constructed of incombustible material shall be so constructed as is completely seperate all wood work or combustible material on the inside of the building from exposure to outside fires, windows and doors; provided this this section shall not apply to water-closets and provies.
SEC. 3. All repairs to buildings already constructed of incombustible material shall comply with the requirement of section two hereof.

Sec. 4 No wooden buildings now erecting in said fire shall be registered by
action, nor shall the same be enlarged or increased so as to increase the danger of fire.

Sec. 5 No building constructed of combustible material shall be moved into said fire limits, and none now is fire limits shall be moved into any other part thereof, except from one point to another on the same lot, which shall be for the purpose of erecting a building in its place, such as is described in section 3 of this ordinance And then by permission of the first being had.
Sec. 6. No chimney or flue shall be so constructed in any building so as to come in contact with any wood or combustible material, and all chimneys shall be thoroughly plastered on the inside

Sec. 7. When any building of incombustible walls and roof shall become injured in such a way as to expose combustible material such walls and roof shall be repaired within ten days after notice by counsel.

Sec. 8. When any wooden building now within said fire limits shall be damaged by fire to the extent of one half of the original value it shall be torn down and removed within shall have been within or be his agent by the

Sec. 9 who shall construct, repair or any building otherwise than is permissible this ordinance, or who shall repaired altered, , removed entirely, to this shall be deemed guilty in each day while each building is being erected, changed, altered or maintained contrary to this ordinance, shall be fined for each offense not less than ten nor more than one hundred dollars

Sec. 10. This ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after five days after and publications.
Passed the city council Jan. 25, 1837. Approved Jan 27, 1837 Attest: W.H. Taylor, Mayor. W. F. Edwards, City Clerk.
Your petitioner for this represents that said ordinance is wholly void and beyond the power of the said city counsel of said city to pass.
That said counsel have no authority under the charter of said City to pass said ordinance.That the said J.R. Snyder Justice of the Peace as aforesaid was wholly
